intro: Parsonsia effusa, commonly known as the flame vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, orange-red flowers. The plant produces showy, clustered blooms that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Parsonsia effusa is a climbing shrub that can grow up to several meters in height, with woody stems and persistent leaves.
